articles.author: Gram Slattery, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: A source told Reuters that Trump, who has criticised the scale of U.S. military and financial support for Kyiv and said he will end the war quickly, had spoken to Putin in recent days.
articles.title: Source says Trump told Putin not to escalate in Ukraine, Kremlin denies they spoke

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces sent tanks into the western side of Gaza's Nuseirat camp in a new incursion into the enclave's central area, causing panic among the population and displaced families.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 11 Palestinians as tanks roll into central Gaza camp

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council is discussing a British-drafted resolution that demands Sudan's warring parties cease hostilities and calls on them to allow safe, rapid and unhindered deliveries of aid across front lines and borders.
articles.title: UN Security Council considers action on Sudan war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has ratified a mutual defence treaty with Russia signed by the two countries' leaders in June, which calls for each side to come to the other's aid in case of an armed attack, state media KCNA said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea ratifies mutual defence treaty with Russia

articles.author: Praveen Menon, Renju Jose
articles.description: New Zealand on Tuesday offered a rare national apology to victims and families of hundreds of thousands of young people and vulnerable adults who were subjected to institutional physical and sexual abuse over the last 70 years.
articles.title: New Zealand offers national apology to people abused in care

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard suggested on Monday that the Mexican government could retaliate with its own tariffs on U.S. imports if the incoming Trump administration slaps tariffs on Mexican exports.
articles.title: Mexico economy chief suggests possible tariff retaliation against US

articles.author: Muvija M
articles.description: Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury and spiritual leader of the global Anglican church, faced mounting calls to resign on Monday over a report that his institution had covered up prolific abuse of boys and young men.
articles.title: Church of England leader Welby urged to quit over abuse cover-up

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Haitian Prime Minister Alix Didier Fils-Aime took office on Monday as the nation's new interim leader pledging to improve security even as armed gangs flexed their muscles with a brazen attack on a commercial plane attempting to land in the capital.
articles.title: New leader takes helm in Haiti pledging to stem spiraling violence

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Donald Trump selected U.S. Senator Marco Rubio to be his secretary of state, sources said on Monday, putting the Florida-born politician on track to be the first Latino to serve as America's top diplomat once the Republican president-elect takes office in January.
articles.title: Trump taps US Senator Marco Rubio for secretary of state, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Data provider DDHQ projected on Monday that President-elect Donald Trump's Republican Party had won a majority in the U.S. House of Representatives, which would signal that Republicans would hold a majority in both chambers of Congress.
articles.title: DDHQ projects that Republicans will retain US House majority
